channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Contest
item.description: Read about our columnists’ favorite and least-favorite stocks and see how they performed.

item.title: Tech stocks see steepest three-week slump in two years, led by plunge in Amazon and Intel
item.description: With quarterly earnings largely in the rearview mirror, Wall Street is troubled by what it's seeing out of Silicon Valley.

item.title: The Score: CrowdStrike, Apple, Intel and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: DraftKings to tax winning bets in high-rate states in a bid to boost profit
item.description: DraftKings will implement a gaming tax on winning bets in some states where the tax rate is highest, including Illinois, New York, Pennsylvania and Vermont.

item.title: Growth Fears Rattle Markets; Nasdaq Suffers Correction
item.description: A summer swoon in the stock market intensified Friday after a disappointing jobs report renewed worries about slowing growth.

item.title: Berkshire's mounting cash pile could top $200 billion as Buffett continues selling stock
item.description: The Omaha-based conglomerate's cash hoard is likely to exceed its previous record of $189 billion when it reports quarterly earnings Saturday.

item.title: What Bill Ackman Got Wrong With His Bungled IPO
item.description: One of the world’s most celebrated hedge-fund managers just pulled the plug on a new fund. He might have gotten a warmer welcome if the deal had been better for all.

item.title: Linde extends its streak of earnings beats, flexes ability to handle any economy
item.description: The industrial gas supplier continues to deliver earnings growth in an "industrial recession" over the past several quarters.

item.title: AI vs. Financial Analysts: Who Is Better at Predicting Earnings of Public Companies?
item.description: A new study finds that, once again, large language models can outperform humans. But not in certain situations.

item.title: Coterra's strong energy production allowed for big cash returns to shareholders
item.description: We're cutting our price target in acknowledgment that commodity prices have come down as the economy is slowing.
